Description: Foot and body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery plate; white slip, interior: cat outside, frieze of lions (head, underbelly and legs of one on left, added red on mane; rump, hind leg and tail of second lion), both to right; incised rosettes as filling ornament; inside, tongue pattern between pairs of bands; in tondo, probably goose with outspread wings (head and wing remaining); pendant rosette as filling ornament; exterior: reserved with two bands on wall and another over lower wall and foot; reserved underside of foot.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2141) (phase 2)
